intro: Linum gallicum var. medium, commonly known as the French flax or intermediate flax, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Linaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for gardens and wildflower habitats. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in fiber production, it is sometimes cultivated for both aesthetic and practical purposes.
